title: Wireless Network Security Fundamentals: Project-Based Detection and Analysis

context.prior_knowledge: Basic computer and internet usage comprehension
context.additional_context: Learners analyze simple security threat cases in real Wi-Fi environments and explore methods to identify anomalies through mathematical approaches

learning_goals: Learners can distinguish 12 or more common types of attacks that can occur in wireless networks.
Learners can mathematically identify anomalous patterns in network traffic using frame analysis tools.
Learners can complete a project detecting malicious traffic by applying a simple classification model (k-NN or fuzzy logic).
Learners can classify attack types with over 80% accuracy through hands-on practice based on real datasets.
difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
